column4: hey if i have folders in side folders in side folders that all need to have there permissions  changed, how can i change all the sub folders at the same time
You need to use 'chmod' with the 'find' command so that it only changes the directories, not the files
well i have to change all the files also
Something like: find /top_folder -type d | xargs chmod 744
But you don't want the files having the same perms as the directories, do you?
yes
so what will the 744 make it
OK, then chmod -R 544 (or whatever) will do the job
what would the number be for every to read/write/excute
744 is rwxr--r--, which is read perms for everyone, write for owner, execute (or enter directory) for owner
777 is rwx for everyone
but that's very bad, security-wise
so sudo find /dir/ -type d | xargs 777 will do it
it is my www folder, they all have root only so ftp isn't working
No, you left off the chmod command
It would be something like: sudo find /dir -type d | xargs chmod 777
so just throw chmod at the end
But something like "chmod -R 777 www" should also work
Just make sure you specify the full path to the directory. Or change to the one above it first
yes got it thank you sir
Best to check the manpages for 'find' and 'chmod' in case I got something wrong
